revised_title: Discovery of Chloro-Nitrous Gas and Its Properties
tldr: Edmund Davy discovered a new gas, chloro-nitrous gas, by combining chlorine and nitrous gas. He studied its properties, reactions with various substances, and its formation from the mutual action of nitric and muriatic acids. Chloro-nitrous gas has a strong affinity for moisture, bleaches vegetable colors, and forms an acid resembling aqua regia when mixed with water.
